intro: Henricea pharmacearcha, commonly known as the moonflower of the ancient forests, is a striking plant native to the dense, humid regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet, intoxicating fragrance. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a deep green hue. Its roots are known for their medicinal properties, containing compounds used in traditional healing practices. The botanical name reflects its historical significance in both herbal medicine and botanical science.
